intro: Frailea castanea subsp. harmoniana, commonly known as the Orange-flowered Stonecress, is a succulent plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae and is characterized by its compact, rosette-forming growth habit. The plant produces striking orange to red flowers that bloom in spring, adding vibrant color to its appearance. Its leaves are typically fleshy and covered in a fine layer of white powder, which helps reduce water loss. It is well-suited for rock gardens and arid environments due to its drought tolerance and low maintenance requirements.
